jobDescription: Job Number: R0027146 Data Scientist, SeniorThe Challenge: Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence you know the answers are in the data.  We have an opportunity for you to use your analytical skills to improve our Data Science service offerings supporting Federal customers in the Justice and Homeland Security accounts. Youll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. Youll develop algorithms, build predictive analytics, and apply machine learning during your efforts, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help senior leadership of critical federal efforts to protect our nation. Youll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in support of our federal customers.  Empower change with us. Build Your Career: At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and were dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect: access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunka chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowlthe worlds premier data science for social good competitionparticipation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government Youll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. Well help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.  You Have:  -7+ years of experience with developing software solutions using Java 2+ years of experience with using Python, R/shiny, Qlik, or Tableau for data analysis and visualizationExperience with multi-dimensional clustering  -Experience with Machine Learning  -Top Secret clearance  -BS degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Science, Engineering, or Technology and 10+ years of experience with developing software solutions or MS degree and 7+ years of experience with developing software solutions  Nice If You Have:  -Experience with Spark, Elastic Search Machine, or Mahout Learning capabilities  -Experience with Google TensorFlow  -Knowledge of the analytical tools available in the intelligence community (IC)  -Knowledge of DHS passenger and immigration data sets  -Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills  -DHS Suitability clearance preferred or TS/SCI clearance  Clearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Top Secret clearance is required.
